context: Isoprene and 1,3-BD correlated well with 3-EP and nicotine and their concentrations were higher than those of 3-picoline and pyridine. Isoprene is a more suitable marker than 1,3-BD, because it is easier to measure than the gas-phase compound 1,3-BD. Furthermore, its emission is higher than that of 1,3-BD and the background concentrations are low. Also, results from other studies support the possible use of isoprene as an ETS marker (Löfroth et al., 1989).Conclusions The method for 1,3-butadiene and isoprene proved to be precise, sensitive and usable in laboratory tests and field measurements. A more comprehensive validation is, however, needed if the method's performance in other environments is to be confirmed. A very good correlation was found between seven of the studied compounds (1,3-BD, isoprene, pyridine, furfuryl aldehyde, 3-picoline, phenol and styrene) and the ETS markers (3-EP and nicotine). The compounds were regarded as specific for ETS in restaurant environments.
